intro: Pancratium guianense, commonly known as the Guianese yellow nutmeg, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and toxic sap. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it produces red berries that contain the seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
